title: Javautvecklare
description:
På Pensionsmyndigheten pågår just nu en spännande förändringsresa i att utveckla vårt nya förmånssystem från grunden vilket innebär en hel del nyutveckling. Nu söker vi flera Javautvecklare till Stockholm som är samarbetsinriktade och trivs med att arbeta i team!

### **Om jobbet**


Som Javautvecklare hos oss kommer du att ingå i ett team och arbetar utifrån en teambaserad organisation enligt det agila ramverket SAFe. Teamen hos oss är tvärfunktionella och självgående för att kunna hantera alla delar av utvecklingskedjan.


Så här beskriver sig ett av våra team:  

”Vi är ett självorganiserat hybridteam som jobbar enligt det agila ramverket SAFe. Vi arbetar i framkant med tekniska utmaningar som berör utveckling av nästa generations pensionssystem, baserat på mikrotjänster. Vi underlättar kvalitetssäkring av tjänster och system samt möjliggör kontinuerliga leveranser till test och produktion (CD/CI). Utöver det är vår vision att driva innovation och ta ansvar för arkitekturen genom att vara ledande inom vårt område. Tillsammans med teamet kommer du ha möjlighet att utvecklas och arbeta med teknik i framkant.”

### **Din profil**


Som person gillar du teamarbete där man delar med sig av kunskaper och lär av varandra. Du säger din mening, lyssnar på andras och är också bekväm i samarbete på distans då vi arbetar i distribuerade team. Du är också en problemlösare som gillar att omsätta komplexa krav till strukturerad kod och vill delta i att leda oss rätt i teknik och metodik.


Vi bryr oss om vår kultur och hur vi tillsammans påverkar vår gemensamma arbetsplats. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.


Vi söker dig som:

* är utbildad systemvetare, dataingenjör eller har skaffat dig motsvarande kunskaper på annat sätt
* har djupgående Javakompetens och arbetslivserfarenhet som javautvecklare
* har erfarenhet av och trivs med att arbeta i agila team
* behärskar det svenska språket väl


Det är meriterande om du:

* har erfarenhet av Spring Boot
* har erfarenhet av REST-tjänster och JMS
* har erfarenhet av byggprocessverktyg som Jenkins
* är väl bekant med något testramverk, exempelvis JUnit, Cucumber
* har erfarenhet av att arbeta med kod- och byggverktyg som Git och Maven
* har erfarenhet av en modern IDE, gärna IntelliJ

### **Vi erbjuder**


Ett myndighetsuppdrag som är viktigt på riktigt! En arbetsplats där vi värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi tillämpar hybridarbetssätt med möjlighet till distansarbete och på kontoret utifrån en överenskommelse med arbetsgivare. Som statligt anställd har du även goda anställningsvillkor och ett förmånspaket med friskvård, flexibel arbetstid, lediga klämdagar samt goda semester- och pensionsvillkor.


Vårt kontor i Stockholm ligger i nära anslutning till Hornstulls tunnelbanestation där vi sitter i ljusa lokaler.


Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att jobba hos oss här.

### **Bra att veta**


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning. Placeringsort är Stockholm.


Anställningen kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.

### **Din ansökan**

Vi använder ett kompetensbaserat urval och ber dig därför svara på urvalsfrågor i stället för att skicka in ett personligt brev. Har du skyddade personuppgifter, kontakta rekryterande chef innan du ansöker. Vi kan komma att använda oss av arbetspsykologiska tester.


Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.


Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontakta rekryterande chef som hjälper dig med din ansökan.


Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till annonskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför ytterligare kontakt med media-/annonsförsäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.


Pensionsmyndigheten ansvarar för den allmänna pensionen och informerar om hela pensionen. Varje år betalar vi ut cirka 415 miljarder kronor till 2,3 miljoner pensionärer, genomför cirka 911 000 fondbyten och skickar ut 8 miljoner orange kuvert. Vi har ca 25 miljoner digitala kundkontakter per år. Vi är cirka 1700 medarbetare på åtta orter, från Luleå i norr till Halmstad i söder.


#LI-HYBRID #viktigtpåriktigt


Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2025-147 | Kontakt: Lars Nordström, Gruppchef , Ulrika Eriksson, Gruppchef , | Facklig företrädare: Linda Modin, Saco-s 010-4543336, Rickard Rundgren, ST 010-4543115, | Publicerat: 2025-10-16 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-09

title: Fullstackutvecklare till Guideline Geo
description:
*Hos Guideline Geo utvecklar vi världsledande teknik som gör det möjligt att se det som inte syns – det som finns under marken. Våra lösningar används över hela världen, från att upptäcka slukhål och stödja arkeologiska utgrävningar till att lokalisera gasledningar och spåra sprickor i isen i Antarktis. All forskning, utveckling och innovation sker här i norra Sverige, där vi skapar morgondagens geofysiska lösningar.*


Här handlar det om mer än att bygga världsledande produkter. Det handlar om att göra det tillsammans – med nyfikenhet, teknikglädje och människor som bryr sig om både resultatet och varandra. Hos oss får du arbeta med spännande teknik, fantastiska kollegor och en ledare som ser dig. Vi firar små och stora framgångar, delar kunskap och håller fast vid det som är viktigast: att ha roligt på vägen. Vill du vara med på vår resa?  

  

**Vad du kommer att göra**


Som fullstackutvecklare hos Guideline Geo blir du en del av ett agilt team som utvecklar nästa generations geofysiska lösningar. Tillsammans arbetar ni med hela utvecklingskedjan – från kravställning och design till implementering, testning och verifiering i fält.


Du rör dig mellan molnbaserade system och hårdvarunära programmering och får se hur din kod används i verkligheten, i projekt som sträcker sig över hela världen. Här får du kombinera teknik med mening – och vara med och forma hur framtidens utforskning av jorden ser ut.


Vi uppmuntrar dig att testa nytt, tänka annorlunda och utmana gränser. Vi anammar ny teknik, utvecklar våra processer och håller oss nära både forskning och innovation inom vårt område.  

  

**Vad vi förväntar oss av dig**


Vi tror att du har en akademisk utbildning inom datavetenskap eller motsvarande, och några års erfarenhet av fullstackutveckling. Du har ett genuint intresse för ny teknik, känner till best practices inom utveckling och trivs med att arbeta i team där idéer får ta plats.


Hos oss arbetar vi främst med .NET/C#, men också med React, JavaScript och app- och webbutveckling – både online, offline och hybrid. Du behöver inte kunna allt, men du är nyfiken, vill lära dig nytt och tycker om att se hur din kod påverkar helheten.


Som person är du engagerad, kommunikativ och ansvarstagande. Du trivs i ett öppet klimat där man hjälps åt, vågar säga vad man tycker och tillsammans hittar lösningar som fungerar i praktiken. Du uppskattar snabba flöden, korta releasecykler och att se resultatet av det du bygger.  

  

**Vem du kommer att jobba för**


Guideline Geo är världsledande inom geofysik och geoteknik. Vi hjälper kunder över hela världen att kartlägga under markytan genom en unik kombination av teknik, know-how och arbetsflöden.


Med över hundra års erfarenhet har vi lanserat flera världsförsta produkter och fortsätter att driva utvecklingen framåt. Hos oss möts teknik och vetenskap, nyfikenhet och precision – allt genomsyrat av våra värderingar: professionalism, kvalitet, ärlighet och passion.


Att arbeta hos Guideline Geo innebär att vara en del av något större. Här utvecklas du tillsammans med kollegor som delar din drivkraft, nyfikenhet och vilja att skapa teknik som gör verklig skillnad.  

  

**Ansökan**


I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Talent(h)ify. Har du frågor om tjänsten eller processen? Kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Hanna Grahn på **hanna@talentify.se** eller **076-414 83 30** för ett första samtal.


Sök gärna även om du inte uppfyller alla krav – vi vet att de bästa idéerna ofta kommer från människor som vågar tänka nytt.

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare till Guideline Geo
description:
*Föreställ dig att din kod kan avslöja vad som döljer sig under markytan. Att den används för att hitta slukhål innan de uppstår, lokalisera gamla ledningar, hjälpa arkeologer att tolka historia – eller upptäcka sprickor i isen på Antarktis. Det är verkligheten för oss på Guideline Geo.*

*Vi utvecklar världsledande teknik inom geofysik och geoteknik – lösningar som ger människor möjligheten att se det som inte syns. All forskning och utveckling sker här i norra Sverige, där idéer tar form i mötet mellan mjukvara, hårdvara och människors nyfikenhet.*

*Hos oss blir du en del av ett företag som kombinerar avancerad teknik med ett syfte som känns i magen: att förstå världen på djupet – bokstavligt talat.*  

  

**Vad du kommer att göra**


Som mjukvaruutvecklare hos Guideline Geo kliver du rakt in i hjärtat av vår R&D-verksamhet. Här jobbar du i ett agilt team som ansvarar för hela utvecklingskedjan – från krav och design till implementation, test och verifiering i fält.


Du får bygga system som integrerar sensorer, hårdvara och molnbaserade plattformar. Ena dagen kan du arbeta med datainsamling i realtid från fältinstrument, nästa dag med visualisering i React eller backendlogik i modern .NET. Det är bredden som gör jobbet spännande – och att du ser hur din kod faktiskt används i verkligheten, inte bara i labbet.


Hos oss lär du dig nytt varje dag. Du får insyn i hur geofysiska mätningar fungerar, hur data rör sig från markytan till molnet, och hur tekniken hjälper våra kunder fatta bättre beslut.  

  

**Vad vi förväntar oss av dig**


Du har några års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling och en bakgrund inom datavetenskap, systemutveckling eller liknande. Du tycker om att arbeta nära produkten och trivs när teori möter praktik.


Hos oss arbetar vi bland annat med .NET, Azure, DevOps, React och JavaScript, men vi vet att tekniker förändras och att nyfikenhet är det viktigaste verktyget. Vi tror att du gillar att ta ansvar, dela kunskap och bidra till en kultur där det är lika naturligt att diskutera kod som att testa något nytt i fält.  

  

**Vem du kommer att jobba för**


Guideline Geo har utvecklat banbrytande teknik i över hundra år och är idag världsledande inom geofysik. Vi har lanserat flera världsledande produkter och fortsätter varje dag att tänja på gränserna för vad teknik kan åstadkomma.


Här arbetar människor med olika bakgrund – utvecklare, ingenjörer, forskare och experter – förenade av samma driv: att skapa lösningar som bidrar till förståelse, säkerhet och hållbarhet. Vår kultur präglas av nyfikenhet, professionalism och passion. Vi tror på att teknik är som bäst när den föds ur mening, och att utveckling ska vara både utmanande och rolig.

**Ansökan**
-----------


I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Talent(h)ify. Har du frågor eller vill du veta mer? Kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Hanna Grahn på hanna@talentify.se eller 076-414 83 30 för ett första samtal.


Sök gärna även om du inte uppfyller allt. Vi vet att innovation uppstår i mötet mellan olika erfarenheter och perspektiv – och vi välkomnar dig som vill vara med och utveckla framtidens teknik, under ytan.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
**Company Introduction:**
 Airspace is a tech-enabled freight forwarder that’s redefining how the world’s most critical packages are delivered. Headquartered in Carlsbad, California, Airspace has employees who are based around the world. Our European headquarters is in Amsterdam, The Netherlands.
   

  

 As a recognized leader in AI and machine learning, our team leverages data and patented technology to coordinate logistics across a global network of drivers and airlines. Our goal is to deliver those packages that are truly mission-critical in a way that is faster, more transparent, more secure, and more accountable than ever before. The items we deliver range from organs for transplant, to parts for critical machinery including grounded aircraft and highly sensitive components such as semiconductors.
   

  

 Airspace has been rated one of America’s best Startup Employers, listed as one of CNBC’s Disruptor 50 companies, and featured as an Innovation and Disruption leader by CBS News. Airspace has the support of leading investors such as Telstra Ventures, HarbourVest Partners, Defy Partners, DBL Partners, and Scale Ventures. To date the company has raised more than $140m.
   

  

 The company is growing rapidly and serving more places around the world than ever before. We are looking for passionate, motivated individuals who want to make an IMPACT every day to help us execute on our mission of reshaping the world of time-critical logistics.
   

  

**What we are looking for:**
 We are growing our Development Team and looking for naturally curious and passionate Full Stack Developers within React & Ruby on Rails to join our journey of revolutionizing time-critical logistics worldwide.
   

  

 Together with our diverse R&D team, you will be building features that will save time, money, and in some cases lives. With our team, you will have a lot of freedom to find the right solutions and processes and have a direct impact on the daily lives of our users and customers. Next to shaping the product, you will also be part of building and establishing a great engineering culture. So don’t miss out and hop on the Airspace plane!
   

  

**Your Role & Responsibilities:**
* You will work closely with our product team to find and develop smart technical solutions that make our logistic processes more efficient
* You will take an interest in “the whole picture” to understand how time-critical logistics works in different industries to build the right features in the best way
* You will design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code and architectures
* Maintaining code quality through test automation and peer code reviews
* Collaborate with a team of smart and friendly engineers to develop solutions unique to logistics
* Continuously growing your software craftsmanship as well as soft skills in a fast paced environment
* You will be working on exciting and complex problems within the time-critical logistics domain
* You will be working with Ruby on Rails application with a React (MobX) UI used by international customers and the internal operations teams
* Working with API Integrations with different providers from airlines to courier partners;
* Responsible for existing or new microservices (Go and Ruby) to assure that our architecture is scalable enough to handle our growth
* Continuously working on smaller features and bug fixes as well as bigger projects including architectural changes
* Writing tests and improvements to our code delivery pipelines


**Ideal Background and Skills:**
* 3+ years of professional backend and frontend development experience using modern web frameworks, preferably React and Ruby on Rails
* Knowledge in building, maintaining, and using Rest APIs and microservices
* Strong knowledge in executing clean, high quality, well tested code
* Fluent in English (Dutch and other languages are a plus)
* Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Strong prioritization and time management skills
* A passionate, friendly, and humble team player
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment with people from different geographies and backgrounds
* A strong self-motivated and pro-active mindset with a keen eye for details and problem solving


**Compensation & Benefits:**
* Strong compensation & benefits package: Competitive salary with opportunities for promotions, bonus, and more.
* Growth Opportunities: The sky's the limit, we will invest in you like you invest in our company and we maintain a strong track record of rapid promotion of high achievers
* Opportunity to work and develop for a cutting-edge global leader: Airspace is reshaping the face of an industry that is increasingly in the spotlight. You will get the chance to be a member of an impactful, rapidly growing organization, and work with leaders, partners, and blue-chip customers across the globe
* Freedom & flexibility: The role is hybrid with flexible requirements regarding office attendance and encourages creativity, responsibility, and self-development in scoping & executing the key responsibilities
* Excellent culture with fantastic colleagues & open-door culture: A global team of highly skilled and motivated team members is there to make your day. Our management team will work to ensure your voice is heard and that we are all working to reach the same goals!


**Core Values:**
* We are One Team. We believe we all accomplish more when we are working together.
* We make an Impact. We are determined to have a positive influence on our environment, our customers, our industry, and our world.
* We are Passionate. We care deeply about our mission and are not afraid to raise the bar.
* We are Transparent. We pride ourselves on having open, honest, and sincere communication with our team and customers.
* We are Innovative. We never settle and are always striving to improve our product, service, and ourselves.


**About Airspace:**
 From life-saving organs to essential machinery components, Airspace is trusted by the world’s largest companies and most critical healthcare organizations to move their most time-sensitive shipments on time, every time. Our proprietary AI-powered platform is the most advanced of its kind- awarded and protected by multiple patents, it provides speed, reliability, and transparency unrivaled in time-critical logistics. We are thinkers, builders, and doers; from building and deploying AI in the world to assembling a world-class operations team, Airspace is on a hypergrowth trajectory while remaining hyper-focused on the needs of our customers and team members.
   

  

 With offices in the United States in Carlsbad, CA and in Europe in Amsterdam, Frankfurt, Stockholm, and London, we are rapidly scaling into new markets and industries while continuing to innovate and maximize value for our customers. Backed by leading investors including Telstra, HarbourVest, Prologis, Qualcomm, Defy, and others, Airspace has raised $140M to date.
   

  

 Join our team of 300+ technologists, futurists, and industry veterans as we work as One Team to revolutionize time-critical logistics.
   

  

 Airspace is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Additionally, Airspace participates in the E-Verify program for all locations.
   

  

 For this role the acquisition of recruitment agencies is not appreciated, thank you for your understanding.

title: Software Engineer, Frontend
description:
**Who We Are💙**
 Here at Waitwhile we're on a mission to eliminate the 1 trillion hours people spend waiting in lines every year. Our platform combines virtual waitlists, scheduling, real-time updates, messaging, and analytics to make access to places, services, and events seamless, online or in person. Trusted by 10,000+ companies, Waitwhile has already helped over 150 million people enjoy a radically better waiting experience. Our clients include IKEA, Chanel, Costco, Google, Delta Airlines, and thousands more. We’re just getting started, and we need your help.
   

  

**The role 💼**
 We’re looking for a talented Frontend Software Engineer to join Waitwhile’s mission of eliminating waiting. You’ll help shape our product by designing and building advanced UIs that balance flexibility and simplicity, creating experiences that delight users and meet the high expectations of global brands.
   

  

 Joining a small-but-growing team, you’ll collaborate closely with our CTO and other members of Waitwhile to develop our web apps. With user experience at the core of what we do, you’ll play a key role in scaling our frontend platform and ensuring it remains intuitive, powerful, and reliable.
   

  

 This position is based in Stockholm at our bright offices on Kungsgatan 32. We’re a hybrid company and prefer that you work from the office at least 2 days per week, as we believe the best product gets built together, live.
   

  

**What You’ll Do🚀**
* Advanced UI development: building settings UIs, guest journey builders, message template logic, and other complex flows.
* Component libraries and reusable modules: ensuring consistency, scalability, and performance across the product.
* Best-in-class user experience: balancing powerful features with intuitive design to save customers time and delight end users.
* Performance and optimization: driving improvements in responsiveness and frontend scalability for large enterprise use cases.
* Collaboration: working with Product Managers, Designers, and Backend Engineers to conceptualize and ship impactful new features.
* Quality and standards: contributing to engineering best practices, tooling, and processes while assisting our skilled support team and operations team in triaging and resolving production issues.


**What Skills You Need 📖**
* 3+ years of experience building web applications, especially with Angular.
* Strong skills in Typescript/JavaScript.
* Experience with performance optimization and troubleshooting.
* Contributes to architecture discussions and technical decisions.
* Writes testable, maintainable code and has experience with automated testing.
* Strong communication skills, able to explain technical concepts to different audiences.
* Solid understanding of computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, distributed systems).
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English.
* You have completed a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field


**Bonus Skills & Attributes 🙌**
* You're experienced with NX mono repos or RxJS
* You've worked at a Startup or built a SaaS platform
* General expertise in distributed systems and databases


**A great place to work❤️**
 We want Waitwhile to be an incredible place to work. We offer great benefits and perks, flexible working hours and lots of interesting challenges. We believe in making work fun and rewarding and care about your development and are committed to your success. Join Waitwhile at this exciting stage and help shape both our future and your own.
   

  

*Waitwhile has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. We aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, what are you waiting for? Apply for this job!*

title: Full-Stack Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable backend services using Java (Spring Boot).
* Build and enhance intuitive frontend interfaces using React.
* Collaborate with product owners, UX designers, and DevOps engineers to deliver high-quality features end-to-end.
* Ensure system reliability, performance, and security through robust architecture and clean code practices.
* Participate in code reviews, pair programming, and knowledge-sharing within the team.
* Stay up to date with emerging technologies, ensuring modern and efficient solutions.


**Tech Stacks**
 Backend: Java, Spring Boot, REST APIs, Microservices
   

  

 Frontend: React, TypeScript, HTML5, CSS3
   

  

 Database: PostgreSQL / MySQL / MongoDB
   

  

 Cloud & DevOps: AWS / Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, GitHub Actions)
   

  

 Other: Maven/Gradle, Git, Unit Testing (JUnit), Agile/Scrum
   

  

**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* 6+ years of professional experience in backend development (Java / Spring Boot).
* Solid experience working with React or similar frontend frameworks.
* Strong understanding of API design, microservices, and modern software architecture.
* Experience in Agile environments and collaborative team setups.
* A proactive, solution-oriented mindset with the ability to take ownership of features from concept to deployment.
* Excellent communication skills and fluency in English & Swedish


**Application deadline:** 
 27-10-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Frontend Developer with focus on UX/UI
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we're building cutting-edge gaming products that redefine how players experience online entertainment. As we continue to grow, we're looking for a Frontend Developer with a strong UX/UI focus, or a UX/UI Designer with frontend development chops, to join one of our expanding engineering teams.
 



  





 You'll play a key role in shaping the look, feel, and interactivity of products that reach a global audience—contributing not only to how things work but also how they feel. At Evolution, design and development are not siloed; you'll be an essential part of product decisions from day one, working in highly collaborative, autonomous teams.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Design and build intuitive, responsive, and beautiful interfaces with React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Bring UX and UI designs to life—from wireframes to pixel-perfect implementation.
* Collaborate closely with product owners and engineers to craft seamless user experiences.
* Own the frontend from concept to production, including performance optimization, accessibility, and maintainability.
* Contribute to our design system and help shape a consistent visual language across products.
* Continuously experiment, iterate, and improve based on real user feedback and data.
* Be part of a team that values learning through iteration, experimentation, and shared responsibility.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have solid experience with React, TypeScript, and modern CSS techniques.
* Possess a keen eye for design details, and care deeply about creating delightful user experiences.
* Enjoy bridging the gap between design and development.
* Are comfortable building advanced components.
* Believe in clean, maintainable code and smooth user flows.
* Have good communication skills in English and love working in a collaborative environment.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Understanding of accessibility and web performance best practices.
* Familiarity with UI/UX testing tools or user research methods.
* An interest in gaming or digital entertainment interfaces.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 We care more about your potential than checking every box. If you're excited about building exceptional interfaces and love working in small, empowered teams, we want to hear from you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing tech companies and help us craft experiences that players around the world love.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



  





 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



  





 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Backend Developer
description:
**About Froda** 




  





 Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear vision – to revolutionize the banking experience for entrepreneurs by making it easy and affordable to invest in their ideas. Today, we are one of Sweden's fastest-growing fintech companies with large international growth plans. We are a creative tech company with the ambition to turn a historically expensive and unfair industry into something ethical and sustainable by promoting entrepreneurship.
 



  





 Our mission to revolutionize the banking experience for entrepreneurs is not only reflected in our products but also in our workplace. By fostering a culture of respect, collaboration, and continuous learning, we provide opportunities for personal growth and professional development. Join us in transforming the banking industry and be a part of our journey to empower entrepreneurs.
 



  





**About The Role** 




  





 To further develop and scale our tech platform, enabling us to continue improving the banking experience for entrepreneurs, we are expanding our tech department. As a Backend Developer at Froda, you will be part of a cross-functional team working in one of our product areas — either developing features for our partners, improving our credit systems or maintaining our loan and payments core. For each team, the idea is to continuously deliver customer value as well as to improve the technical structure to make sure our systems are stable and healthy. Together with your team, you will design, build, and deliver scalable and maintainable solutions that directly impact our customers.
 



  





 You will get a unique chance to be a part of a scaling fintech company with strong momentum and a stable foundation, backed by a banking license as a quality stamp.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




  





 We believe that you are an experienced and curious developer who thrives in collaborative environments and is passionate about building scalable solutions with real impact. You enjoy working closely with other skilled and open-minded professionals and actively contribute to knowledge sharing and continuous improvement. You are a pragmatic problem solver who communicates clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. You are fluent in both English and Swedish.
 



  





 We believe that you have experience of:
 



  




* At least 4 years in a similar role, ideally within product-focused teams
* Programming in C#/.NET with a solid understanding of modern software design principles
* Working with SQL and NoSQL databases in production environments
* Cloud platforms such as Azure (or other major providers)
* Agile methodologies and best practices in software engineering, including testing, CI/CD, and DevOps mindset
* Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, RabbitMQ, and microservices architecture is a strong plus



  





**What’s in it for you?** 




  





 At Froda, you’ll be part of a company that combines the best of both worlds – a fast-moving, high-energy culture with the stability and structure to support long-term success. We’re 100+ ambitious self-starters who genuinely care for each other and the work we do, all while having fun together.
 



  





 Here, you’ll have the opportunity to take ownership of your work, develop your skills, and shape your own growth journey. With big ambitions and a rapidly evolving business, there’s plenty of room to grow, lead initiatives, and make a real impact on both our company and the industry. If you're looking to be part of a success story and contribute to something bigger, this is the place for you.
 



  





 Furthermore, you’ll get:
 



  




* An opportunity to be part of an exciting journey, shaping the future of our company and transforming the SME financing landscape
* Fabulous office overlooking Stockholm and a friendly culture that values work/life balance
* We prioritize working in the office to maximize the positive impact of in-person collaboration, but we offer flexibility with work hours and remote work
* Competitive compensation package
* Insurance and pension plan



  





 This role is all about building the tech that powers funding for thousands of entrepreneurs —if you're excited by our mission, apply or tell a friend!
